meanings: (뒤쫓다) pursue, chase (after), run after; (흔적·증거 등을 이용해서) trail, track

vlive.korean: 모기쫓기, 고기 잘 굽기 등 인터넷으로 알아봤어요. I learned how to repel mosquito and to grill meat. 듣기 View video 10PM : [10pm2 화] 김풍의 풍기문란-김풍 demoralizing behavior
vlive.english: I learned how to repel mosquito and to grill meat.

vlive.korean: [진 뒤를 바짝 쫓는 뷔] - 안 돼 - 안 돼! [V is chasing Jin] - No! - No! 듣기 View video BTS : Run BTS! 2020 - EP.107
[바짝 쫓는 범규에나] 비켜요! [BEOMGYU-ena is chasing] Get out of my way! 듣기 View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : TO DO X TOMORROW X TOGETHER 2020 - EP.10
vlive.english: [BEOMGYU-ena is chasing] Get out of my way!

vlive.korean: [다정하게 파리 쫓는 진영] 저리 가! [JINYOUNG is so sweet to the flies] Go away! 듣기 View video GOT7 : GOT7(갓세븐) TOURLOG EP.10
vlive.english: [JINYOUNG is so sweet to the flies] Go away!

vlive.korean: 그래서 알아보려고 저도 쫓아나간 거겠죠? So I guess I'm chasing after her to get to know her better? 듣기 View video BTOB : 비투비 - 비트콤 #96 (프니엘 'FLY23' M/V 비하인드)
vlive.english: So I guess I'm chasing after her to get to know her better?

examples.korean: Quitting my job to chase my dream of opening my own restaurant was the best decision I’ve ever made. 발음듣기 나만의 식당을 열겠다는 내 꿈을 쫓기 위해 일을 그만둔 건 내가 한 결정 중에 최고의 결정이었어. DARAKWON
examples.english: Quitting my job to chase my dream of opening my own restaurant was the best decision I’ve ever made. 발음

examples.korean: She drank coffee to fight[shake] off sleepiness. 발음듣기 그녀는 졸음을 쫓기 위해 커피를 마셨다 Neungyule
examples.english: She drank coffee to fight[shake] off sleepiness. 발음

examples.korean: It was used to scare away ghosts. 발음듣기 귀신들을 쫓기 위해 행해졌었다. Neungyule
examples.english: It was used to scare away ghosts. 발음

examples.korean: Many people use bug sprays to keep insects away. 발음듣기 그래서 많은 이들은 벌레를 쫓기 위해 방충제를 사용한다. Neungyule
examples.english: Many people use bug sprays to keep insects away. 발음

examples.korean: It was originally used by the U.S. Army to repel insects in the 1940s and 1950s. 발음듣기 DEET는 원래 1940~1950년대에 미군이 벌레를 쫓기 위해 사용했었다. Neungyule
examples.english: It was originally used by the U.S. Army to repel insects in the 1940s and 1950s. 발음
